intro: Quercus arrecta, commonly known as the Mexican evergreen oak, is a species of evergreen oak native to Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and dense, dark green foliage that remains throughout the year. The leaves are typically narrow,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy surface. It produces small, urn-shaped flowers followed by acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife. This plant is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
